abstract_summ: RESULTS: A screening VNE is outlined that can be performed on a wide variety of patients, along with detailed descriptions of virtual examination maneuvers for specific scenarios (cognitive testing, neuromuscular and movement disorder examinations).OBJECTIVE: To outline features of the neurologic examination that can be performed virtually through telemedicine platforms (the virtual neurological examination [VNE]), and provide guidance for rapidly pivoting in-person clinical assessments to virtual visits during the COVID-19 pandemic and beyond.This study evaluates the patient experience during virtual otolaryngology clinic visits implemented during the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic.We present a comprehensive virtual foot and ankle examination for telehealth visits, including instructions that can be provided to patients verbatim and a corresponding checklist for provider documentation.The COVID-19 pandemic has necessitated a rapid and drastic shift for clinicians and patients away from traditional in-person visits and toward Internet-based virtual visits.
title_summ: The Virtual Neurologic Exam: Instructional Videos and Guidance for the COVID-19 EraVirtual scribing within otolaryngology during the COVID-19 pandemic and beyondTelemedicine in the Era of COVID-19: The Virtual Orthopaedic ExaminationAssessment of Patient Experiences in Otolaryngology Virtual Visits During the COVID-19 PandemicThe Virtual Foot and Ankle Physical Examination[Formula: see text].Guidelines for Resident Participation in Otolaryngology Telehealth Clinics During the COVID-19 Pandemic.Timely Advice for Implementation During the COVID-19 Public Health Crisis.Virtual Visits in Ophthalmology:
